text: An Air Force Instruction (AFI) is a documented instruction for members of the United States Air Force. It is intended for use by active duty, guard, and reserve members and associated civilians. It is one of many forms of directives published by the Air Force Departmental Publishing Office (AFDPO).Air Force Departmental Publishing Office. About Us, US Air Force e-Publishing Homepage. Retrieved December 31, 2012. In almost all cases, an Air Force Instruction is a form of a general order; and violation of the AFI by an Airman subject to it can be punished under the Uniform Code of Military Justice. ==References== Category:United States Air Force
title: Air Force Instruction
